intro: Pholiurus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pholiurus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds.
